section.title: More than ... 超过
section.para: In November, ten terrorists attacked India's financial center, Mumbai. More than one hundred sixty people were killed during two and a half days of violence.

Farmers can start rotational grazing by removing animals from a pasture when the grass is eaten to less than five centimeters. The pasture is then kept empty until the grass grows to more than fifteen centimeters high.
More than one ...
More than one adjective can come before a noun.

section.title: less than ... 不到,少于
section.para: Farmers can start rotational grazing by removing animals from a pasture when the grass is eaten to less than five centimeters. The pasture is then kept empty until the grass grows to more than fifteen centimeters high.

section.title: most of 大部分
section.para: Most of the paint had crumbled off. 油漆大都剥落。
Most of the rock in this mountain is shale. 这座山上大部分的岩石都是页岩。

section.title: Must be 一定是
section.para: You must be Ms. Wang.

section.title: neither ...nor ... 既不...又不...
section.para: He answered me, but he spoke neither slowly nor clearly.

section.title: need time to
section.para: Grasslands need time to rest when cattle and other animals feed on them.

section.title: form ... to ...
section.para: Moving animals from one area of pasture to another can provide the time needed for new growth.

section.title: have to 必须，不得不
section.para: I have to complete my taxes by April 15th. 我必须在四月十五日之前交清税。

section.title: …turns me off.真受不了…
section.para: He really turns me off. 他真叫人受不了。
It really turns me off when he starts talking about how smart he is.每当他说起自己有多聪明时，我真受不了。

section.title: I'm crazy about…我对…着迷
section.para: I'm crazy about my new computer .我对我的新电脑着迷了。

section.title: get along with… 与…处得来
section.para: Do you get along with all your relatives? 你跟所有的亲戚都处得来吗？

get along with….与…处得来。 例：Do you get along with your in-laws?你和你的亲家处得来吗？We all get along well with each other.我们都处得很好。How do you get along with your brother?你和你的兄弟处得来吗？We're getting along really well with each other.我们处得很融洽。

section.title: I have a complex about…我担心…
section.para: But now I have a complex about my weight. 但现在我开始担心自己的体重。
I have a complex about…我担心…例：.I have a complex about being late.我担心会迟到。

section.title: I ... to ...
section.para: I want to get a better job.
I need to make more money.
I like to learn new things.
I hate to wash the dishes.

section.title: You'd / We'd better... 你们/我们最好···

para.literallayout:
用法透视 这个句型用来建议别人"最好做......"，后面跟不带"to"的动词不定式。也可以说"had best"，但不那么常用。
支持范例 1. You'd better hurry up if you want to get home before dark. 如果你想天黑前到家就抓紧时间。 2. We'd better leave her alone since she is so mad. 既然她那么生气，我们最好让她自己呆着。 3. We'd better not bother him. 我们最好不去烦他。
会话记忆 A: It is reported that the temperature is going to drop dramatically tonight. 有报道说今晚会大幅降温。 B: Really? 真的吗？ A: Yes. So you'd better dress warmly before you go out. 真的。你出去之前最好穿暖和一点儿。 B: I will. Thanks for telling me. 我会的。谢谢你提醒。

section.title: ...really bug me …真令人心烦
section.para: The car honking really bugs me. 汽车的喇叭声真让人心烦。
...really bug me …真令人心烦。例：That really bugs me! Could you tell him to stop it?真烦人，能让他停下来吗？That man sings the same song over and over again. He really bugs me! 那男的把一首歌反复唱来唱去，真让人心烦。

section.title: rather than 与其…倒不如，不是…而是
section.para: It is a telex rather than a letter. 与其说它是一封信，不如说它是一封电传。
These are political rather than social matters.这是政治问题而不是社会问题。
Rather than risk breaking up his marriage he told his wife everything. 他惟恐婚姻破裂，把一切都告诉了妻子。

section.title: go over
section.literallayout:
v.(渡过...)转变, (对...进行)仔细检查, 润色, 复习
go over one's notes 从头到尾看笔记 go over the test scores. 检查考试成绩 We must go over the mountain. 我们必须越过那座山。 To go over the top of. 上升到顶部；超过顶部 a new style that didn't go over. 不受欢迎的新样式 You'll have to go over this composition. 你必须重做篇文章。 We'll tackle up and go over there. 我们将备马去那里。 Your spending should not go over your income. 你应量入为出。 We'll go over this question at the meeting. 我们将在会上研究这个问题。 To go over extensively in the mind;ponder. 思虑仔细而广泛地考虑；思索

section.title: find out
section.literallayout: find out vt. 找出(查明,发现,想出,认识到,揭发出来) Examples: We must find out the customs of other countries, so that they will not think us ill mannered. 我们必须知道别的国家的习俗，免得他们会认为我们是没有礼貌的。 Find out what the conditions of the contract are. 弄清楚合同的条件是什么。 Let's find out. 我们去问一下吧。

section.title: Perfect for / Not for ...
section.para: Perfect for an interview!
Not for an interview!

section.title: come up with ...
section.para: Let come up with a solution.
section.literallayout: 1. 赶上 We came up with a group of tourists. 我们赶上了一群旅游者。 2. (针对问题等)想出;提供 He came up with good ideas for the product promotion. 他想出一个推广产品的好方法。 He could not come up with a proper answer. 他想不出一个合适的回答。 3. 准备好(钱等) You must come up with the money by tomorrow night. 你明晚之前必须准备好钱。

section.title: come up with 提出，想出，提供
section.literallayout: 1. 赶上 We came up with a group of tourists. 我们赶上了一群旅游者。 2. (针对问题等)想出;提供 He came up with good ideas for the product promotion. 他想出一个推广产品的好方法。 He could not come up with a proper answer. 他想不出一个合适的回答。 3. 准备好(钱等) You must come up with the money by tomorrow night. 你明晚之前必须准备好钱。
